channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Camp Mystic in Texas, Where 20 Children Are Missing, Is Nearly a Century Old
item.description: Camp Mystic, on the banks of the Guadalupe River in Hunt, Texas, has been operated by generations of the same family since the 1930s.

item.title: Celebrating the Fourth of July Across the Country
item.description: Displays of patriotism were evident at parades and hot dog eating contests, even at a time of deep political divisions among Americans.

item.title: China’s Rare Earth Origin Story, Explained
item.description: Low environmental standards helped China become the world’s low-cost producer of rare earths, but Beijing was also focused on helping the industry.

item.title: China Has Paid a High Price for Its Dominance in Rare Earths
item.description: Dust and groundwater contaminated with heavy metals and radioactive chemicals pose a health threat that the authorities have been trying to address fo...

item.title: The most urgent alerts came in the middle of the night.
Man Attempts to Set Fire to a Melbourne Synagogue
item.description: None of the approximately 20 people who were inside the synagogue were injured in the attack, the latest in a surge of anti-Jewish acts in Australia.

item.title: Vietnam Aches for Its M.I.A.’s. Will America Stop Funding Science to Identify Them?
item.description: New breakthroughs in DNA analysis offer a chance to identify more of the lost from wars and disasters stretching back decades — if the U.S. helps.

item.title: Wall Street was expecting a TACO Tuesday. But Dow futures fall 250 points after Trump says he will set tariffs as high as 70%
item.description: Trump said that about “10 or 12” tariff letters would go out Friday, with additional letters coming “over the next few days.”

item.title: Trump plans to start notifying countries of U.S. tariffs up to 70%
item.description: Trump told reporters that about “10 or 12” letters would go out Friday, with additional letters coming “over the next few days.”

item.title: At least 13 dead in Texas floods and more than 20 children missing from a girls summer camp
item.description: At least 10 inches of rain poured down overnight in central Kerr County, causing flash flooding of the Guadalupe River.

item.title: Trump signs ‘One Big Beautiful Bill’ into law: What that means for your money
item.description: The bill will have ripple effects throughout the economy—and Americans' bank accounts.

item.title: Democratic Congressman Suozzi’s $50,000 stock sale took advantage of a loophole in Congressional disclosure rules
item.description: The New York rep never disclosed owning the stock, prompting the question of how he managed to sell a security he didn’t appear to own in the first pl...

item.title: Pro-Palestinian Activists Lose Appeal Against U.K. Government Ban
item.description: The decision means that the group called Palestine Action will be banned as a terrorist organization in Britain while its full legal challenge to the ...

item.title: Hamas Says It’s Ready to ‘Immediately” Return to Truce Negotiations
item.description: It was not immediately clear whether the group was demanding any significant changes to the plan for a 60-day truce, hostage-for-prisoner swaps and ta...

item.title: U.K. F-35B Jet Takes Unplanned Vacation in India, Is Embraced by Locals
item.description: A British F-35B has been stranded for weeks at an airport in southern India because of mechanical issues. The internet, and the region’s tourism agenc...
